segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Detailed File Share, which allows you to audit attempts to access files and folders on a shared folder.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Detailed File Share, which allows you to audit attempts to access files and folders on a shared folder.

segment.source: Audit Detailed File Share allows you to audit attempts to access files and folders on a shared folder.
segment.target: Audit Detailed File Share allows you to audit attempts to access files and folders on a shared folder.

segment.source: The Detailed File Share setting logs an event every time a file or folder is accessed, whereas the File Share setting only records one event for any connection established between a client and file share.
segment.target: The Detailed File Share setting logs an event every time a file or folder is accessed, whereas the File Share setting only records one event for any connection established between a client and file share.

segment.source: Detailed File Share audit events include detailed information about the permissions or other criteria used to grant or deny access.
segment.target: Detailed File Share audit events include detailed information about the permissions or other criteria used to grant or deny access.

segment.source: There are no system access control lists (SACLs) for shared folders.
segment.target: There are no system access control lists (SACLs) for shared folders.

segment.source: If this policy setting is enabled, access to all shared files and folders on the system is audited.
segment.target: If this policy setting is enabled, access to all shared files and folders on the system is audited.

segment.source: High on domain controllers because of SYSVOL network access required by Group Policy.
segment.target: High on domain controllers because of SYSVOL network access required by Group Policy.

segment.source: Low on member servers and workstations.
segment.target: Low on member servers and workstations.

segment.source: Audit Success for this subcategory on domain controllers typically will lead to very high volume of events, especially for SYSVOL share.
segment.target: Audit Success for this subcategory on domain controllers typically will lead to very high volume of events, especially for SYSVOL share.

segment.source: We recommend monitoring Failure access attempts: the volume should not be very high.
segment.target: We recommend monitoring Failure access attempts: the volume should not be very high.

segment.source: You will be able to see who was not able to get access to a file or folder on a network share on a computer.
segment.target: You will be able to see who was not able to get access to a file or folder on a network share on a computer.

segment.source: IF – If a server has shared network folders which typically get many access requests (File Server, for example), the volume of events might be very high.
segment.target: IF – If a server has shared network folders which typically get many access requests (File Server, for example), the volume of events might be very high.

segment.source: If you really need to track all successful access events for every file or folder located on a shared folder, enable Success auditing or use the Audit File System subcategory, although that subcategory excludes some information in Audit Detailed File Share, for example, the client’s IP address.
segment.target: If you really need to track all successful access events for every file or folder located on a shared folder, enable Success auditing or use the Audit File System subcategory, although that subcategory excludes some information in Audit Detailed File Share, for example, the client’s IP address.

segment.source: The volume of Failure events for member servers should not be very high (if they are not File Servers).
segment.target: The volume of Failure events for member servers should not be very high (if they are not File Servers).

segment.source: With Failure auditing, you will be able to see who was not able to get access to a file or folder on a network share on this computer.
segment.target: With Failure auditing, you will be able to see who was not able to get access to a file or folder on a network share on this computer.

segment.source: IF – If a workstation has shared network folders which typically get many access requests, the volume of events might be very high.
segment.target: IF – If a workstation has shared network folders which typically get many access requests, the volume of events might be very high.

segment.source: If you really need to track all successful access events for every file or folder located on a shared folder, enable Success auditing or use Audit File System subcategory, although that subcategory excludes some information in Audit Detailed File Share, for example, the client’s IP address.
segment.target: If you really need to track all successful access events for every file or folder located on a shared folder, enable Success auditing or use Audit File System subcategory, although that subcategory excludes some information in Audit Detailed File Share, for example, the client’s IP address.

segment.source: The volume of Failure events for workstations should not be very high.
segment.target: The volume of Failure events for workstations should not be very high.

segment.source: With Failure auditing, you will be able to see who was not able to get access to a file or folder on a network share on this computer.
segment.target: With Failure auditing, you will be able to see who was not able to get access to a file or folder on a network share on this computer.

segment.source: 5145(S, F): A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.
segment.target: 5145(S, F): A network share object was checked to see whether client can be granted desired access.
